intro: Mammillaria rhodantha f. fulvispina, commonly known as the red-spined mammillaria, is a compact cactus native to Mexico. It features a rounded stem with prominent, reddish spines that give it its distinctive appearance. The plant produces yellow flowers during the spring and summer months. It is well-suited for rock gardens and requires well-draining soil and full sun. Due to its delicate nature, it is often cultivated as a prized ornamental plant.
